pullRequest.title: Migrate pxf-json to Spring Boot
pullRequest.bodyText:
Update top level build.gradle to include pxf-json
Add new build.gradle for pxf-json
all existing unit tests should be ported to junit 5
make test on java 11
automation tests passing for JSON

Co-authored-by: Francisco Guerrero aguerrero@pivotal.io
Co-authored-by: Alexander Denissov adenissov@pivotal.io

commit.message:
Migrate pxf-json to Spring Boot

- Update top level build.gradle to include pxf-json
- Add new build.gradle for pxf-json
- all existing unit tests should be ported to junit 5
- make test on java 11
- automation tests passing for JSON

Co-authored-by: Francisco Guerrero <aguerrero@pivotal.io>
Co-authored-by: Alexander Denissov <adenissov@pivotal.io>

nodes.bodyText: wonder why we need to depend on this and not only on slf4j-api ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+apply plugin: "java-library"
+
+jar {
+    enabled = true
+}
+
+dependencies {
+    /*******************************
+     * API Dependencies
+     *******************************/
+
+    /*******************************
+     * Implementation Dependencies
+     *******************************/
+
+    implementation(project(':pxf-api'))
+    implementation(project(':pxf-hdfs'))
+    implementation("org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-log4j2")

nodes.bodyText: can we reuse a single object Mapper if we do not customize its behavior ?
